node.title: Jury awards $14 million to George Floyd protesters in Denver
node.description: "Hopefully, what police departments will take from this is a jury of regular citizens takes these rights very seriously," one lawyer said after the verdict.

node.title: January 6 committee members may subpoena Justice Clarence Thomas' wife
node.description: Several sources told CBS News that some members want Ginni Thomas to meet with the committee and will issue a subpoena if necessary.

node.title: Residents fight back against packs of aggressive canines
node.description: A petition is calling for something to be done about packs of dogs harassing people in Ōtara, but local politicians say the problem runs deeper than just animal management.

node.title: University reviews sexual misconduct complaints after similar case
node.description: The University of Auckland is facing another allegation of sexual misconduct, and is now reviewing its handling of all similar cases.

node.title: NASA pressing ahead with critical moon rocket test
node.description: NASA faces tough schedule with moon rocket test, private astronaut launch and space station crew rotations.

node.title: Weekend gatherings in Christchurch keep police busy in March
node.description: Christchurch police have arrested six people and fined 40 others for breaching liquor laws in suburbs near Canterbury University.

node.title: Police: 'groups' involved in woman's death on Gisborne Street
node.description: Police have launched a homicide investigation after the death of a woman on a Gisborne street.

node.title: Orlando theme park rider appeared to question seat restraint before teen's fatal fall
node.description: "Why doesn't this have a little click to it, like a seatbelt?" the person said.

node.title: US tech giants face tough new rules with new EU deal
node.description: Tech giants may have to change their core business practices in Europe as EU countries and EU lawmakers clinched a deal on landmark rules to curb their powers.

node.title: RNZ-TVNZ public media shake-up: What you need to know
node.description: Explainer - What's the government doing with RNZ and TVNZ - and why? RNZ is here to clear it all up. Audio

node.title: New Orleans public schools lift century-long ban on jazz music and dancing
node.description: The decision comes exactly 100 years to the date it was originally passed in 1922, school officials said.

node.title: Hiker found dead in Montana likely killed by grizzly bear, sheriff says
node.description: Grizzlies have killed at least eight people in the Yellowstone region since 2010.

node.title: Job postings for remote work rise, as many say they like it
node.description: Dropbox is among the tech firms to go "virtual first," with most work taking place outside of company offices.

node.title: Airlines want to drop mask rules. Is now the right time?
node.description: Carriers say it no longer makes sense to have masking and testing requirements in place. Epidemiologists aren't so sure.

node.title: Utah legislature bans transgender athletes from girls sports after veto
node.description: Critics have called the bill an "attack" on transgender children.

node.title: East Coast flooding: Dry weather forecast for today - but low front still off coast
node.description: Tairāwhiti could receive much needed dry weather today but several key roads in the region are impassable because of flood damage.

node.title: Republicans try out midterm messages during Jackson hearings
node.description: Several GOP senators saw Jackson as a foil for themes they hope will not only motivate their base, but also help sway white suburban voters who turned away from the party during the Trump era.

node.title: Parole recommended in 1976 Chowchilla kidnapping case
node.description: The recommendation came during Woods' 18th attempt to earn parole for what has been called the largest kidnapping in U.S. history.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," March 27, 2022
node.description: Illinois Republican Congressman Adam Kinzinger, Former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Marie Yovanovitch, and more appear this Sunday on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan"

node.title: Foreign Minister to visit Fiji next week
node.description: Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta is departing on Monday, and her visit will include talks with Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama.

node.title: Heaviest deluge in Central Hawke's Bay in 10 years - mayor
node.description: Central Hawke's Bay District Council is anticipating an expensive bill as it prepares to clean up from heavy rain that has hit the area over the past two days.

node.title: Hundreds of Canterbury DHB staff off work due to Covid-19
node.description: Canterbury nurses who volunteer for extra shifts in aged care are getting payments of $350 per night for covering chronic Covid-related staff shortages.

node.title: Walkers find sheep on Australian mountain with 40kg fleece
node.description: An Australian sheep has had a lucky break after bush walkers discovered the animal who was rocking a 40 kilogram overgrown fleece.

node.title: Online sports gambling is a home run, but not yet with investors
node.description: Heavy spending on marketing for new customers by companies like DraftKings and FanDuel are weighing down their stocks.

node.title: What is white phosphorus, and is Russia using it in Ukraine?
node.description: White phosphorous can ignite fast-burning fires and inflict extreme burns, making it particularly hazardous for civilians in war zones.

node.title: Australia to roll out fourth Covid-19 vaccine dose ahead of winter
node.description: Australia will roll out a fourth dose of Covid-19 vaccines to its most vulnerable population starting next month, authorities said.

node.title: U.S. confirms Ukraine struck Russian resupply ship
node.description: Russian forces also appear to be running low on air-launched cruise missiles.

node.title: Surging mortgage rates are pricing people out of buying a home
node.description: Rate on a 30-year mortgage has jumped to 4.4%, quashing dreams of homeownership for many Americans.

node.title: Uncle arrested after 12-year-old nephew dies of fentanyl overdose, officials say
node.description: The boy was directed by his uncle, Troy Nokes, 35, to clean drug paraphernalia that contained fentanyl, authorities said.

node.title: Oscars 2022: Listen to the five best song nominees
node.description: Hear the five songs up for this year's Academy Award, including performances by Billie Eilish, Beyoncé, and Van Morrison.
